titleStmt.title: Isaac Whitehead to James F. Robinson
CWG8959

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Rockcastle County } Sct

To Hon James F Robinson Govenor of the Commmonwealth of Ky, Your Petitioner, Isaac Whitehead, states that at the August term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court 1863. ThHe fHwas fined twenty Dollars for Gaming and that your Petitioner is a very poor man and lives in a part of the Commonwealth that has been badly torn up by the two contending armies and that we have to haul our Provisions some twenty or thirty miles for our children to eat. therefore your Petitioner asks your honor to remit his fine and confer a special favor upon him and his Family
We The undersigned Petitioners state that we believe the statements of the Petition of Isaac Whitehead in the above Petition are true and that he deserves Executive clemency

James G Carter
M, A, Brooks
W H Kirtle Clk Rct
R. R. Hackney
D. G. Colyer
We hope that you will remit the fine against Isaac Whitehead

G Pearl
Judge of the 12th Judicial Dist of Ky
H F Finley
Comths Att. 12th Judicial Dist, Ky

Rockcastle Cir. Ct
$20.
Fine Remitted
J F Robinson
J. Whitehead
Issd Aug 15. 1863
